instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-0045: What is 820-0045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not Power On
threads.message:
hi,
i have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  motherboard but i have seen 5v on f4700 pulse. ıt loops on and off.  Where should I focus now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not Power On
threads.message: Check for short to ground on all secondary power supplies (big coils).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not Power On
threads.message: hi i checked but not short to ground on

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not Power On
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not Power On
threads.message:
I tried with another charger. Right now, there are 20 volts stable on f7400 but there are no 3.3 volts on <RESISTOR>R1450</RESISTOR> as stated on the video. Also, there are no 3.3 volts on L7561 neither. Device's amp stays at 0,02. 
There are 8.6 volts on F4800.
There are no 5 volts on L7520. 
There are no 5 volts on L7510.
There are 3.3 volts on L7595.
[MEDIA=youtube]F-sTAO9BEqE:147[/MEDIA]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not Power On
threads.message:
"there are no 3.3 volts on <RESISTOR>R1450</RESISTOR>"
Any resistor has 2 (two) pins.
You should specify where did you check the voltage!

BTW, before looking for S3 and S0 voltages, you need to get S5 and SUS voltages.
You didn't post <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS yet.

I can't find L7595 in the schematic...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not Power On
threads.message:
There are 000.8 ohms on the video but on my board there are 1.7 megaohms.  I don't think there is any short circuit here but again there is no voltage on L7520. When I give it 5 volts like on the video, it gets 0.02 amps. There is no short circuit.
Could you show me on schematics what voltage should I get from which part? e.g. "You need to get 5 volts on first leg of <CAPACITOR>C7522</CAPACITOR>. "
What do you mean by SUS voltages? Could you specify? There are more than one hundred labeled SUS... Could you give exact parts and how many volts should I get?

<RESISTOR>R8187</RESISTOR> 1-2 no volts

<RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> 2- 5 volt  <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> 1- 19 voltage

<CAPACITOR>C7002</CAPACITOR> 1-  19 voltage

L7095 1-2 3,3 voltage

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not Power On
threads.message:
You have the board on the desk.
Why don't you specify readings on the real points?
Why should I watch a video instead???

"There are 000.8 ohms on the video but on my board there are 1.7 megaohms."
Please, post accurate information.
Help us first, providing usefull information.

"I can't find L7595 in the schematic..."
What schematic are you using???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not Power On
threads.message:
I do not know where I need to read which voltage so I ask you.Why do not you want to understand me, If I knew I wouldn't write to you anyway :( You are telling me to write descriptive information, instead we can go faster if you show me through the diagram. Can you tell me this way? If you give me this information as if you need to read 5 volts on the 1st leg of the L7510, I will check it and write to you and we will progress better. L7595 I'm sorry I misspelled it will be L7095 I read 3.3 volts on the 1st and 2nd leg.When I first give power to the motherboard, it pulls to 0.30 and drops to 00.2 and stays there and does not turn on.
L7520 has no voltage on PİN 1 PİN 2

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not Power On
threads.message:
"There are 000.8 ohms on the video but on my board there are 1.7 megaohms."
You've already specified something which can help, but I wanted to know where exactly did you measure that.

"Check for short to ground on all secondary power supplies (big coils)"
Maybe not all are really bigs, but you can find them in pages 44-52.
Page 51 showed you many power MOSFETs, where you have to check for short on their outputs too.

"ıt loops on and off"
Any pulse at L7510 at same time?

"You didn't post <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS yet.
-----------
 Could you show me on schematics what voltage should I get from which part?"
What about L7560 and <CHIP>U8020</CHIP>?

Be patient, you will understand the schematics in time; just pay atention.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not Power On
threads.message:
There is no voltage on C216's, <CAPACITOR>C1204</CAPACITOR>'s & <CAPACITOR>C8020</CAPACITOR>'s 1st.
Also no voltage on L7560 & L7510's 1st & 2nd.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not Power On
threads.message: Take your time and reply to all above mentioned...
